Posts.Content: Thanks for the responses, as fairwind mentioned, the psa rise and the doubling time is still slow, before 0,080 it was 0,064. So it is still undetectable, if it would have been G 6 or 7 ı could have been more relaxed, but since it is G-9...the rise shoul be monitored really closely, hope it doesn't reach 0,1 mark soon...
Posts.Title: rising psa

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the advices, the last psa reading was 0,134 and before that it was 0,112...but still, doc didin't want to act quickly, cause he had an mrı on early june, and there was no evidence of reccurence. The test is tomorrow, but it seems that, even the scans show no signs of reccurence...it is almost certain that something is going on. Well until that moment he's managed well with G-9 and positive margine, but of course it was a chance that there was no lymph node or seminal vesicle invasion...
Posts.Title: rising psa

Posts.Content: Well folks, we got our result yesterday...it's 0,198, so it' s still rising. We'll take an mrı next week to see what the stiuation is...but stil ı have a feeling that there's a chance that we may not find any action...when it was 0,112 there was no evidence of reccurence, but ı think sooner or later G-9 is not gonna keep itself concealed..
Posts.Title: rising psa

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter sapporo, Sorry you have to be here but welcome. Like us most likely he tested his PSA every three months for the first year so he should have at least 4 to 5 PSA readings. Do you have his PSA history? If you do you can calculate his doubling time using EXCEL curve fit software. The MSK nomogram would not estimate doubling time for any number less than .1 since it is known that small PSA numbers (<.1) tend to bounce around a lot and are not reliable predictors. However, to play devil's advocate, using just the two number you provided, and assumed a linear increase, the doubling time is >12 month which, even if the cancer is coming back, is very good news as doubling time of >12 months predicts very good outcome. Of course I am not a physician and my opinion is just a layperson's opinion. Good luck. Well, thanks for your encouraging words, actually my father was back to back tested at first 6 months, ı mean month after month. Then he begun testing on 3 months period, ı think the doc did it because of G-9 and the positive marjin...this is going to be his twelth reading, 0, 064 reading was 3 months ago, and before that, it was 0,045 and now 0,080. He is going to be tested tomorrow, like you said the doubling time is not too high, burt it'S not one year, three months...
Posts.Title: rising psa

Posts.Content: Well, hi again folks...it's been a long time since my last post, my father had rp on march 4 2011, his gs was 4+5, no seminal or lymph node invasion but a micro meth on the bladder neck. His psa was 6,5 before the surgery...his stage named as t3a, first psa was 0,009 and after a while it began to rise a little bit, his last reading was 0,080 3 months ago. He didn' t have any other therapy ( like hormone or radiation )...but ı think even though, the readings are not still that bad, those little cells are trying to multiply. His margins were positive also, it seems that the radiation and the hormone parts are getting closer, ı think the doc didn't want to use the tools until the psa really shows some action, best luck to everyone.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ASAdvocate If I'm reading your number notations correctly, you have a psa of 1.16 ; a free psa of 0.16 ; and a percent free ratio of 13.7. While the 13.7 might be suspicious, the free psa test is not valid for a psa below 4, so you can't dwell on that. In summary, you have a good psa (even for your age), and imaging negative for lesions. If you have not discussed the test with your doctor, do so and consider his/her advice. Otherwise, don't rush ahead and worry yourself needlessly. Thank you very much , for the quick reply...I didn' t know that my free ratio was 13.7 , cause ı do not know how to calculate. As ı understand that reading is not so good but ,not diagnostic un less your readings are between 4 - 10 mg. Well , like you mentioned my total psa reading is quite ok even with my age. But maybe doc will order additional follow up because of my father's aggrressive disease. By the way , my prostate is 27 gr. according to the ultrasound , and there was evidence of ongoing edema , because of my probable prostatities.

Posts.Content: Hi guys, I ' ve been a member at this site for nearly 5 years...But no activites lately. Because of my father's prostate cancer , I used to hang out here ,for gathering information and talking with other people who have more experience about the disease. My father is doing ok , despite a gleason of 4+5 , hanging around for nearly 6 years. Now it ' s about me and my condition...I' ve been having constent back pain and urinery disconfort in my pelvic area and sometimes at my stomach. The pain goes away very rarely , but very mild indeed. I went to see a doctor after 6 months...He asked for complete blood tests ( which was all ok. ) , and urinery test , than an ultrasound. The urinery test and blood tests were all normal , ultrasound was ok, too...But he radiogolojist asked me whether ı had a prostatities or not. He told me that there are some calcification marks on the prostate gland , but then mentioned nothing seems important. After the test result , ı went to se the doc who performed my father' s surgery. I told him what was going on...He listened carefully , and then said , those calcifications seem very minor to me ,and even didn't have the need to check my prostate ( the finger ). He only wanted blood tests of total PSA , free Psa and free/ total PSA . I got the test results today , Total PSA : 1, 16 - Free PSA : 0,16 - Total/ Free PSA : 0,14. Until today , I only cared about total PSA , but from what ı read lately , the less you have a Total / Free PSA , the more likely you might have a prostate cancer. Yet , it is said that when the PSA range is between 4- 10 mg. ,the total/ free psa is much more important...But still ,it made me unconfortabe anyway. So do you guys have any information about this researches , if you do, I ' d like to hear some thoughts and opininions...By the way I 'm 40 years old.
Posts.Title: Curious about free Psa and free/ total psa ?

Posts.Content: [QUOTE=HighlanderCFH;236272]Hi there, I don't recall from your previous posts, but did your dad have surgery? Yeah, from what I can see, it appears that his doctor may be using the current upward trend in the PSA and projecting it into the future under the assumption that it will continue to rise and then double. Wait for others, though, to chip in with their own thoughts & comments. . Yes highlander he had operation on early march of 2011...and his psa has been checked regularly since 2011, and no further treatment was given but operation.
Posts.Title: Curıous about doublıng time ?, doc made me confused !

Posts.Content: I have a question folks, and hi everyone too by the way.... my father's reading on early 2013 September was 0, 198, and late March 2014, it was 0, 279...and now we're seeing an oncologist. I am confused about the doubling time, as far as ı know the reading of 0, 198 should be around 0, 400 or something if it's doubled, and if it happens in 6 months, we could call, the doubling time as 6 months !...at least that's what ı know But doc said that the doublıng time is 4 months, and it's even not close to 0,400 mark...but he was tested back to back for 3 months...2013 december ( 0,246 ) , 2014 January ( 0,243 ) , 2014 February ( 0,220 ) and finally 2014 March ( 0,279 )...but at the end if we wouldn't have seen the rise and fall of the number in 3 monts period, we wouldn't have known it...so it would have been 0, 198 and 0,279 in 6 time periods...and in my knowledge it wouldn't have been doubled...so am ı right, or am ı missing something important in this story !!
Posts.Title: Curıous about doublıng time ?, doc made me confused !

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind Hi Sapporo...Maybe you could put together a brief "Signature" to add to your posts so everyone would know your treatment history... Only a few types of PC can spread without leaving a substantial PSA marker..But if you have had recent surgery and these are your last 3 PSA tests, then yes, a visit with a Radiation Oncologist to discuss Salvage Radiation treatment might be in order..Bone scans, at least the ones insurance companies are willing to pay for, seldom show anything until the PSA is north of 50 or so....I would let the R/O make the decision on whether a bone scan would be worthwhile at this point... Fairwind, than you for all the info you've been given, ı hope you're doing well with your treatment too. Unless it's small cell carcinoma or another rare type of pc, it unlıkely to met the bones, but at the end of the night it's G-9. Well ı think doc made the decision, friday is scheculed for the bone scan, hope we don't see any suprises. Anyone who have no clue about my father pc, here is the summary. He has been diagnosed on early june of 2011, and had surgery on march 4 2011. The biopsi showed melignancy on 9 of 12 samples from the prostate, and gleason was 8 by then. But after the surgery it upgraded to G-9 ( 4 + 5 ) the path report wasn't that bad, but surely it had something....no seminal or lymph node invasion, positif margine, and also identified micro meth on the bllader neck. Then first psa came...it was 0,009, then the second one 0,012, then lıke that...0,009, 0,017, 00,25, 00,45, 00,64, 00,85, 0,112, 0,135, 0,198, 0,243, 0,240, 0,220 and finally as you know 0,279 it's been 3 years...he has come this far without any further treatment but operation...
Posts.Title: Bone met with very low psa ?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Wishing him the best of luck! Chuck Thank you HighlanderCFH , ı wish you the same
Posts.Title: Bone met with very low psa ?

Posts.Content: Hi folks, it's been really a long time since my last post. After the psa reading came back 0,243, the doc wanted to check it out, month by month...0,243 reading was on late december...then it dropped to 0,240, and a month later it was 0, 220 which was good news. But the last reading wasn't that good that, it came back as 0, 279, now doc is asking for a bone scan and adds that, ı think now is really the right time to see a radiologist...but ı wonder, even with gleason 9, is there really a chance that it might spread to bones with this very low psa readings ?...ı know that gleason 9 cells doesn't produce much psa...but still, it seems really low to take an action lıke that...ıt would be wonderful to see some opınınons, and thoughts
Posts.Title: Bone met with very low psa ?

Posts.Content: We got the results... as expected for god sake, there wasn't any evidence of mıcro meth to the bones, but as you mentioned Fairwind, we' ll see Radiation Oncologist despite no meth...it's time to act before the doubling time speeds up. It's better to get radiation before it gets to 1.0 mark !!
Posts.Title: Bone met with very low psa ?
